[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Module-level] [Progress monotonicity] Can pruner progress ever decrease (roll back), and if so, do these functions handle non-monotonic Version values safely? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Integration] [LedgerDb dependency] Does get_ledger_pruner_progress() properly handle cases where LedgerDb.metadata_db() returns None or invalid reference after database reload? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Integration] [StateKvDb metadata access] Can StateKvDb.metadata_db() be accessed concurrently by multiple pruner threads without proper locking, causing data races? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Integration] [StateMerkleDb generic constraints] Are the generic constraints on StateMerkleDb sufficient to prevent type confusion when multiple StaleNodeIndexSchemaTrait implementations exist? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Integration] [get_progress utility] Does the get_progress() helper in utils/mod.rs properly handle all edge cases, or can it return incorrect results for certain DbMetadataKey variants? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Integration] [DbMetadataSchema consistency] Can DbMetadataSchema be modified concurrently during schema migrations, causing get/put operations to access wrong schema versions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Security] [Byzantine validator] Can a Byzantine validator with < 1/3 stake manipulate their local pruner progress to create state divergence, forcing network partition? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Security] [State sync attack] Can an attacker exploiting pruner progress manipulation prevent new validators from syncing by ensuring critical historical state is prematurely pruned? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Security] [Database injection] Can malicious input to progress_key parameter in get_or_initialize_subpruner_progress() enable database key injection attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Security] [Metadata authentication] Are metadata values authenticated or can local database tampering modify pruner progress without detection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Performance] [Progress read frequency] If pruner progress is read on every pruning operation, can high-frequency get_progress() calls cause performance degradation or database lock contention? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Performance] [Database I/O amplification] Can frequent initialization checks in get_or_initialize_subpruner_progress() cause I/O amplification affecting validator performance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Robustness] [Error message clarity] Do Result types provide sufficient error context for debugging pruner failures, or can vague errors hide root causes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Robustness] [Graceful degradation] If pruner progress cannot be determined, do these functions fail gracefully or can they cascade failures affecting consensus? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Robustness] [Retry logic] Do these functions implement retry logic for transient database errors, or can temporary failures permanently corrupt pruner state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Testing] [Concurrent access testing] Are race conditions between concurrent pruner threads tested, or can untested concurrency bugs surface in production? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Testing] [Fault injection] Are database failure scenarios (corruption, I/O errors, schema mismatches) tested to ensure robust error handling? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [Type safety] [Version arithmetic] Can Version (u64) arithmetic in pruner logic using these functions cause overflow/underflow in calculations like version + batch_size? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/pruner_utils.rs] [State machine] [Progress state transitions] Can pruner progress transition to invalid states (e.g., progress > current_version) due to missing validation in these utility functions? (High)
